column1: Messad (sometimes Messaad) is a town in Algeria. It was the Roman Castellum Dimmidi.

It is about 290 km (180 mi) south of Algiers. During the Roman period it was known as Castellum Dimmidi after the Romans under emperor Septimius Severus seized the settlement. It is unclear if the second part of the name
column3: was a native name transliterated into Latin
column4: or a new name given by the Romans.

column2: the settlement was a fortress along the Limes Tripolitanus
column3: the southern border of the province of Numidia. It was a prosperous village and hosted a Roman garrison from roughly 198 to 240 AD.Messaad has a population of nearly 120
